intro: Stemmadenia sinaloana, commonly known as the Sinaloan stemmadenia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its small, white flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance.
